description: Deep dive into Vue's template power: Conditional rendering, Loop rendering, and Custom Directives.

slides.title: What are Directives?
slides.content:
# Special Attributes ü™Ñ

Directives are special attributes with the `v-` prefix.

They apply special reactive behavior to the rendered DOM when the value of the expression changes.

Example: `v-if`, `v-for`, `v-bind`, `v-model`.

slides.title: v-if vs v-show
slides.content:
# Conditional Rendering ü´£

**v-if:** True conditional rendering. Does NOT render the element if false.

**v-show:** Always renders, but toggles CSS `display: none`.

Use `v-show` if you toggle functionality often (cheaper). Use `v-if` if the condition is unlikely to change (initial load).

slides.title: v-else & v-else-if
slides.content:
# Else Logic ü§∑ Must follow a `v-if` or `v-else-if` element immediately. ```html
A
B
Not A/B
```

slides.title: v-for
slides.content:
# List Rendering üìã Loop through arrays or objects. ```html
  • {{ item.message }}
    • ``` **Always provide a unique `:key`** to help Vue track node identity.

slides.title: Loop Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Why is the :key attribute important in v-for loops?
quizOptions: It helps Vue track identity for performance
It is required for arrays only

slides.title: v-for on Object
slides.content:
# Looping Objects üì¶ You can iterate through properties of an object. ```html
{{ index }}. {{ key }}: {{ value }}
```

slides.title: v-for with v-if
slides.content:
# v-for vs v-if ü•ä

**Avoid using them on the same element.**

`v-if` has higher priority than `v-for` in Vue 3 (reverse in Vue 2), meaning `v-if` won't have access to the loop variable.

Solution: Wrap the loop in a `<template>` tag.

slides.title: v-on Modifiers
slides.content:
# Event Modifiers üîß

Suffixes to change event behavior.

- `.stop`: `event.stopPropagation()`
- `.prevent`: `event.preventDefault()`
- `.once`: Trigger only once
- `.self`: Trigger only if event.target is self

```html
<form @submit.prevent="onSubmit"></form>
```

slides.title: Key Modifiers
slides.content:
# Keyboard Events ‚å®Ô∏è

Listen for specific keys.

```html
<!-- Only call submit when Enter is pressed -->
<input @keyup.enter="submit" />
```
Common aliases: `.enter`, `.tab`, `.delete`, `.esc`, `.space`, `.up`...

slides.title: Code Example
Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Directives üéì

Template Logic.

- **v-if / v-show:** Visibility.
- **v-for:** Loops (Need `:key`).
- **v-on:** Event handling + modifiers (`.prevent`).
- **v-model:** Two-way binding.
- **Custom:** `v-my-directive`.
